qas.question: At what Augusta hole was the Eisenhower Pine located?
How many meters away from the Masters tee on Augusta's 17th was the Eisenhower Pine?
What did Eisenhower want to be done to the Eisenhower Pine?
What damaged the Eisenhower Pine in February 2014?
In what year did Eisenhower propose that the pine tree named after him be removed?

context: A loblolly pine, known as the "Eisenhower Pine", was located on Augusta's <a0_0>17th<a0_0/> hole, approximately 210 yards (<a1_0>192<a1_0/> m) from the Masters tee. President Dwight D. Eisenhower, an Augusta National member, hit the tree so many times that, at a <a4_0>1956<a4_0/> club meeting, he proposed that it be <a2_0>cut down<a2_0/>. Not wanting to offend the president, the club's chairman, Clifford Roberts, immediately adjourned the meeting rather than reject the request. The tree was removed in February 2014 after an <a3_0>ice storm<a3_0/> caused it significant damage.
